question: Which state auctions India's most expensive limestone block which covers 357 hectares of area with an average grade of 43% CaO?
explanation: Chhattisgarh auctions India's most expensive limestone block .The bid received 96.15% of IBM (Indian Bureau of Mines) prices. Kesla-II block of Raipur district of Chhattisgarh and covers over 357 hectares of area with an average grade of 43% CaO.
